t: Amazon and OSHA reach settlement agreement and OSHA vacates all but one of its previous citations
s: December 19, 2024 - Amazon and OSHA reach settlement agreement. The U.S. regulator agreed to withdraw all but one of the ergonomic citations it issued to Amazon.

t: OSHA cites Amazon for unsafe warehouses as injury numbers remain high
s: April 15, 2023 - Industrywide numbers for last year won't be released until November, but OSHA head Doug Parker said Amazon has a history of injury rates that are far higher than others in the warehouse category. In 2021, Amazon's injury rate was almost 1.5 times the industry average.

t: U.S. Department of Labor's OSHA recognizes Amazon.com in New Castle, Del., for continued success in employee safety and health | Occupational Safety and Health Administration
s: "Amazon.com's Delaware Fulfillment Center consistently has demonstrated a strong commitment to employee safety and health," said Domenick Salvatore, director of OSHA's Wilmington office. "The company has maintained an injury and illness rate below the industry average for three years." The Delaware Fulfillment Center services millions of online customers. The center predominately warehouses books and music CDs, and has 450 employees. Designed ...
